thread.title: Five Dragons earn All- Conference honors
thread.title_full: Five Dragons earn All- Conference honors

author: Times staff
title: Five Dragons earn All- Conference honors
text: By Times Staff Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 1:18 AM A trio of Pekin boys have earned All-Conference honors for their performance during the 2015 boys golf season. Junior Lance Hays was named to First Team All-Conference. Hays advanced to the Class 3A state final over the weekend where he tied for 67th place. Joining Hays for First Team All-Conference were three members of the state champion Morton Potters — brothers Pete and Tommy Kuhl and sophomore Issac Ingold. A pair of teammates from second-place Dunlap — Ethan Uken and Trevor Hickey — also were awarded honors. Rounding out first-team honors were David Perkins of East Peoria and Trey Tussey of Metamora. Jack Halstead and Carter Taphorn of Pekin were both awarded Second Team All-Conference honors. Joining them were Tyler Coughlin and Hunter Watts of Washington, Gabe Sowards and Evan Fairfield of Dunlap, Matthew Cox of East Peoria and Peyton Johnson of Metamora. Girls honors Senior Taylor DeGolyer of Pekin was named to the girls golf First Team All-Conference Team. Also awarded honors were a pair of Washington Lady Panthers, Allison Kinsinger and Alyssa Metelak. Chandler Ryan of Morton, Amanda Greenan of Limestone, Mamie Ambrosch and Katlin Paranto of Metamora and Emily Franzoni of Canton were selected as well. Hannah Patterson of Pekin was also named Second Team All-Conference. Meagan Makuta and Hannah Rogers of Morton also received the accolade, along with Erica Whitaker of East Peoria.
